Text: It's also refreshing that Dr. Williams does not deny the mistakes and personnel failures. In fact, he talks a lot about those errors and causes for them with @nickjudin in this urgent interview re ongoing #jxnwater crisis. https://t.co/bJ9L7ikvju

The only way journalism is done well about #jxnwater crisis is to break down and discuss the systemic challenges that lead to low pay and under-qualified workers making errors. Dr. Williams gets real with @nickjudin in this interview. https://t.co/LT3QKAjaYV

Read @nickjudin's thread about his new interview with Dr. Charles Williams about #jxnwater plant challenges, staffing issues and errors. They go deep, and it's important if you care about solving this issues. This interview shows how mistakes are results of systemic issues. https://t.co/SFMjNQGEnd

The City of Jackson declared municipal water once again safe to drink this morning after an electrical fire erupted at the O.B. Curtis Water Treatment Plant early Friday morning, prompting a plant shutdown for fire mitigation and repairs. #JXN #JXNwater https://t.co/SK2qveDrSR https://t.co/f8HfIcDi2f

A drop in water pressure after a fire at the O.B. Curtis Water Treatment Plant prompted a required boil-water notice for all city connections over the weekend, adding additional woes to Jackson’s ongoing water crisis. #JXN #JXNwater https://t.co/kuNztm3Yti https://t.co/965GFhNMZH

Reporter @nickjudin with what we know so far about Jackson's lack of safe water again this weekend. #JXNWater https://t.co/huKKVHiG0C
Here we go again, Jackson. Hopefully, it won't last long. #Jxnwater https://t.co/fPEJAQyRB4
@MSfishOn Yes, another consequence is the #jxnwater crisis, repeated in various versions around the country. GREAT explainer here by @nickjudin: https://t.co/cgBZuWui1u

Read @nickjudin's Part 3 in his #jxnwater series to understand how Jackson water and infrastructure got to this point. It was a lot to do with white flight, reaction to school integration—and the federal guv bailing on help with environmental compliance costs under Ronald Reagan. https://t.co/gGkMmIkAdm

Quite the line-up on @MSFreePress front page this morning; key word across headlines is "systemic"—whether policing, injustice, housing, banking, redlining. Dig in at https://t.co/yZB1iRM26T. Also, watch for Part 3 of @nickjudin #jxnwater series he's been in a cave finishing. https://t.co/q8RHcAOdGD

Reporter @nickjudin and I will be talking #jxnwater and infrastructure with Mayor @ChokweALumumba tomorrow (Thursday) at 4 p.m. live. Join us at link below and bring questions for the chat. https://t.co/7YG2Uhz9hx

SPECIAL #MFPLIve episode and time this week: Join me and the leading #jxnwater reporter @nickjudin as we talk to Mayor @ChokweALumumba about only water and infrastructure for a full hour Thursday at 4 p.m. Watch live here: https://t.co/RdY8uKuaDv https://t.co/GrVzcz5ioS

Don't stop talking about this all, and this NPR show is a great intro to the systemic problems at hand if you haven't heard it yet. Please listen. #jxnwater #infrastructure #water https://t.co/lsZBHIrq9s

3. Now @nickjudin is continuing to lead the journalism on #jxnwater crisis with an important Part 3, coming soon. Meantime, don't let issue fall to the side, and read all 6 pieces he's done since asking that pivotal question to Lt. Gov. Hosemann on 3/1. https://t.co/FKKByOKn2m

2. Then read Part 2 of @nickjudin's #jxnwater crisis series that really unpacked how the crisis came about at the plant-failure level and what is needed now (it's about much more than water towers).  https://t.co/uNszCXwRll

1. Almost a month ago, @msfreepress reporter @nickjudin kicked off his indepth #jxnwater series, revealing Tamiko and Otis Smith's struggle with his dialysis needs during the crisis. Read their powerful story and others Nick found. https://t.co/kWcUpA7Xki

So does #msleg and Speaker @PhilipGunnMS  not have the 2013 engineers' report on #jxnwater needs that @nickjudin detailed here?? Have they read it? That's good start, and it's misleading to indicate nothing like that has been done under Jackson leadership: https://t.co/uNszCXwRll https://t.co/W79vHbBimh

It really is refreshing to see the city, state and hopefully feds working together on this first step in repairing the #jxnwater crisis. Our state could do so much more done with respectful cooperation that seems to be happening here. Credit where it's due to everyone involved. https://t.co/VO5IHerVgp
BREAKING: Huge news tonight by @nickjudin related to #jxnwater crisis up tonight at @msfreepress. A state-city and maybe federal deal is close for some help. https://t.co/VO5IHerVgp

Thanks for @FrancesMadeson for talking to so many Jackson folks about the #jxnwater crisis and for including my @NBCNewsTHINK column about the systemic-racism context in this piece for @capitalandmain:

https://t.co/uWSyw5h1Tf
Ahem, #jxnwater https://t.co/U4hwgRJhlR

In Under the Surface, Part 2, reporter @nickjudin unpacks why two freezes in February crippled the city's distribution system for a full month. It is a piece-by-piece story of the complicated #jxnwater crisis, revealing causes on a long road to solutions.
https://t.co/QdheaQSd83 https://t.co/sTqrYUt7C6

We really can draw moral parallels between forbidding water to Ga voters and #jxnwater crisis. Also to 1960s cutoff of food assistance/commodities in towns like Greenwood MS to Black people trying to register to vote.

Starving kids to preserve power. All a throughline of racism. https://t.co/aILUnzXhjc
Vital, vital, vital addition to @nickjudin's indepth coverage #jxnwater crisis. Full archive too: https://t.co/FKKByOKn2m https://t.co/kBRGrCarCf

March 1 was pivotal for reporting on #jxnwater crisis after @MSFreePress reporter @nickjudin's questions to Lt. Gov. Hosemann changed the narrative into a vital systemic dialogue. Nick's full water archive, including last night's big explainer, are here: https://t.co/FKKByOKn2m https://t.co/EEtTar5h6s

7. I'm glad @nickjudin's 3/1 questions of Hosemann launched much deeper inquiry around #jxnwater crisis, but it's not just about elected officials. It's about men with money our institutions (including media) pander to; parts of Jackson have lived or died depending on their moods

1. This by Mayor Johnson in below #jxnwater piece reminds me of how toxic/racist @clarionledger was toward him back when we started #jxnfreepress (in CL's also-racist #jackpotjustice era). NO focus on expertise, but constant derision in editorials/cartoons about him too slow, etc https://t.co/vB2uc0wtCD https://t.co/12ZTsy8WJr

Also learning from Aaron Packman's expertise. Love that he said that nat'l attention right now to these problems is creating an opportunity, especially for help from federal government, which is vital. THAT is exactly what needs to result from #jxnwater crisis: solutions, change.
My segment is done, but keep listening. So appreciate @OnPointRadio doing this indepth show on #jxnwater crisis and so many other infrastructure breakdowns across the country. https://t.co/ju7VDUx6jn
All, I'm happy to appear on @OnPointRadio today at 9 am central to talk about #jxnwater crisis. Please listen to the show if you can. Link here: https://t.co/6eSt6cEG3V https://t.co/uGpsqhq2kd

One tricky technique is an outlet using a passive in order to leave out credit of reporter who asked questions leading to material they're quoting—"was asked." This happened to @nickjudin recently over pivotal question he asked of state official creating new #jxnwater dialogue.
2. Here's Part 1 of @nickjudin's big #jxnwater explanatory series from earlier this month: https://t.co/kWcUpA7Xki

1. ICYM this amazing @Slate podcast with @nickjudin. It's a good wrap-up of his first several weeks of covering systemic roots of #jxnwater crisis. Listen + read Part 1 of his series; Part 2, 3 coming to take conversation to the next step. We appreciate media followup of his work https://t.co/Tswo6WGNbh

Cheers again to @nickjudin for creating a new dialogue about #jxnwater through his incisive questions weeks ago, then historic reporting and now this long podcast with @slate today. He's amid a deep-dive series; catch up to Part 1 before next one drops: https://t.co/kWcUpA7Xki https://t.co/Tswo6WGNbh

This @Slate podcast with @nickjudin is SO good. Nick is  a brilliant reporter and really breaks down the #jxnwater crisis. Must-listen.

And this broke me: "all that's missing is the red yarn." https://t.co/bSMuyD3Sta

Y'all, listen to @trymainelee here on #jxnwater crisis here using (attributed!) reporting by @nickjudin. Nick took this crisis to a place it needed to be—a discussion of systemic racism and historic neglect—with his questions/writing. @MSFreePress is lucky to have him on the team https://t.co/2axYqOuuRL

My interview this morning about #jxnwater crisis and systemic racism ... and yes I managed to fit in a message to the rest of the country about its bigotry toward Mississippi, too. https://t.co/OUcJnjXUAD

I did this interview this morning at 7 a.m. with @kaiwright for @TheTakeaway about #jxnwater crisis. Not a morning person, so was a bit nervous to listen, but it went well. Listen if you can. https://t.co/wRgsXCO6eV

To flag point, while many were popping corks last year on flag change (we were thrilled too), @msfreepress partner @kimberlydgriffi  and I wrote this about the tests that lay ahead of changing the state flag. State rhetoric-vs-action on #jxnwater big test: https://t.co/v1Z9WRE0d0

NEW: Today Lt. Gov. @DelbertHosemann praised Jackson's last white mayor on #jxnwater: “You remember during Kane Ditto’s administration, he did repair work on water and sewer. So what happened since then?” Then @nickjudin called the city's 1st Black mayor.

According to the @EPA's Water and Wastewater Agency Response Networks (WARNs) website¹ regarding Mutual Aid and Assistance for Drinking Water and Wastewater (H/T to @blustream for the link), #Mississippi does not have a WARN. WOW. #JXNwater #boilwater
___
¹https://t.co/BksMfCaYtu

#Water / #wastewater peeps, is there such thing as mutual assistance when responding to a water supply crisis? This happens with electric outages, I was just curious if it happened with things like city-wide water main breaks? #Jackson #Mississippi #boilwateralert #JXNwater
